ai-thag10.1:1.2_0: they’ve shed their foliage, and are ready to fruit.
ai-thag10.1:1.4_0: great hero, this season is full of flavor.
ai-thag10.1:2.2_0: wafting their scent all around, in all directions.
ai-thag10.1:2.3_0: They’ve shed their leaves and wish to fruit,
ai-thag10.1:2.4_0: hero, it is time to depart from here.
ai-thag10.1:3.1_0: It is neither too hot nor too cold,
ai-thag10.1:3.2_0: venerable sir, it’s a pleasant season for traveling.
ai-thag10.1:3.3_0: Let the Sākiyas and Koḷiyas see you,
ai-thag10.1:3.4_0: heading west across the Rohiṇī river.
ai-thag10.1:4.1_0: In hope, the field is plowed;
ai-thag10.1:4.2_0: the seed is sown in hope;
ai-thag10.1:5.1_0: Again and again, they sow the seed;
ai-thag10.1:5.2_0: again and again, the lord god sends rain;
ai-thag10.1:5.3_0: again and again, farmers plow the field;
ai-thag10.1:5.4_0: again and again, grain is produced for the nation.
ai-thag10.1:6.1_0: Again and again, the beggars wander,
ai-thag10.1:6.2_0: again and again, the donors give.
ai-thag10.1:6.3_0: Again and again, when the donors have given,
ai-thag10.1:6.4_0: again and again, they take their place in heaven.
ai-thag10.1:7.1_0: A hero of vast wisdom purifies seven generations
ai-thag10.1:7.2_0: of the family in which they’re born.
ai-thag10.1:7.3_0: Sakya, I believe you’re the king of kings,
ai-thag10.1:7.4_0: since you fathered the one who is truly called a sage.
ai-thag10.1:8.1_0: The father of the great hermit is named Suddhodana;
ai-thag10.1:8.2_0: and the Buddha’s mother is named Māyā.
ai-thag10.1:8.3_0: Having borne the Bodhisatta in her belly,
ai-thag10.1:8.4_0: she rejoices in the heaven of the Thirty-Three.
ai-thag10.1:9.1_0: When she died and passed away from here,
ai-thag10.1:9.2_0: she was blessed with heavenly sensual pleasures;
ai-thag10.1:9.3_0: enjoying the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
ai-thag10.1:9.4_0: Gotamī is surrounded by those hosts of gods.”
ai-thag10.1:10.1_0: “I am the son of the Buddha, Asoka,
ai-thag10.1:10.3_0: You, Sakya, are my father’s father;
ai-thag10.1:10.4_0: Gotama, you are my grandfather in the Dhamma.”
